text: a neighborhood near the Yemeni capital
Sanaa controlled by the Houthi rebels
the target of airstrikes led by Saudi
Arabia these pictures are from a filthy
television channel which is also
reporting tens of civilian casualties
the strikes began because of fears that
the rebels could take control of the
whole country
prompting Yemen's neighbors in the Gulf
to respond to the government calls for
military help the Kingdom of Saudi ever
launched military operations in Yemen
the objective is to defend the
legitimate government of president Hadi
from the takeover attempts by the Houthi
militias in Yemen we have a coalition of
over 10 countries that are participial
participate in these operations to
prevent human from falling at the hands
of the host one source Al Arabiya News
is reporting numbers of troops and
planes which if correct suggests a
substantial military operation the
rebels have control of the capital Sanaa
last month the president Abed Rabbo
Mansour Hadi fled to the port city of
Aden in the south the rebels then took
control of Aden Airport but it has now
been recaptured by troops loyal to the
president the speed at which the Houthis
were advancing led the Yemeni government
to ask neighboring states for help
fearing the situation was getting out of
control meanwhile on Wednesday the
president fled his palace in Aden but
there is uncertainty about where he is
some reports suggest he has left the
country but his supporters insist he is
still there and running Yemen been bland
BBC news
